content.question: In measures 1–2, which common practice of a pedal 64 chord progression is NOT observed in the chords harmonizing “in summer”?

choices.label: The first and third chords are tonic triads.
The second chord embellishes the first and third chords in the progression.
The bass notes are common tones across the progression.
The pedal 64 chord usually occurs on a weak beat.

content.answer: The pedal 64 chord usually occurs on a weak beat.

unit.text: 5: Harmony and Voice Leading II - Chord Progressions and Predominant Function

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Use symbols and terms to describe melodic, harmonic, and rhythmic relationships in notated music. (This skill is applied in describing these elements in a full musical context.)
